__TOC__



Today's Hug Day will focus on '''The Kernel'''!  With the recent Beta release of Intrepid Ibex 8.10, it's an ideal time to take a look at kernel bugs.  It's important to verify if bugs still exist or have been resolved with the Beta release.  Additionally, it's good to be aware of any New bugs being reported against the Beta release.  Today we'll be focusing on a subset of these types of bugs.  

After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after '''rowbgcolor='''.  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged.

=== 5-a-day-ing ===
During hug days you can also do <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/5-A-Day|5-A-Day]]</nowiki> for this one you can do the following in order to tag your work on the hug day:

* 5-a-day --add-tag hugday-20081007
* Add bugs to 5-a-day as usual
* And when done with hug day run: 5-a-day --remove-tag hugday-20081007

=== Stock Responses ===
See each subsection below for the corresponding stock reply.

=== 100 New Bugs ===
'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Verify the reporter has tested using the latest 2.6.27-5 kernel and has provided the appropriate <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/KernelTeamBugPolicies|kernel debugging information]]</nowiki>
** If the latest kernel has been tested and the debugging information provided, set the status to '''Triaged''', determine an appropriate Importance, and assign the bug to the '''ubuntu-kernel-team'''
** Otherwise, instruct the bug reporter what is missing from the report, set the status to Incomplete, and subscribe yourself to the report
** A possible stock reply would be: <pre>
The 2.6.27-5 Ubuntu kernel was most recently released.  It would be great if you could test and verify if this is still an issue with this newest kernel.  If the issue still exists, per the kernel team's bug policy, can you please attach the following information.  Please be sure to attach each file as a separate attachment.

* cat /proc/version_signature > version.log
* dmesg > dmesg.log
* sudo lspci -vvnn > lspci-vvnn.log

For more information regarding the kernel team bug policy, please refer to https://wiki.ubuntu.com/KernelTeamBugPolicies .  Thanks again and we appreciate your help and feedback.
</pre>

=== 150 Call for Testing Bugs ===
When deciding to move to the 2.6.27 kernel for Intrepid, a call for testing the 2.6.27 kernel was posted to every open linux bug.  The Status of these bugs were not marked as '''Incomplete''' as it would have been a logistical nightmare changing each of those bug's status back to their original state if a decision to not go with the 2.6.27 kernel was made.  The kernel team has however decided to use the 2.6.27 kernel for Intrepid.  For bugs which have not yet responded to the 2.6.27 call for testing and are currently in a New, Confirmed, or Triaged state, it makes sense to now set them to Incomplete.  A recommended stock reply would be:

<pre>
The Intrepid Ibex 8.10 Beta release was most recently announced - http://www.ubuntu.com/testing/intrepid/beta .  It contains the 2.6.27 Ubuntu kernel.  It would be great if you could test and verify if this is still an issue.  The status is being set to Incomplete until we receive further feedback.  Thanks.
</pre>

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Verify the bug indeed has not responded to the 2.6.27 call for testing
* Post a comment about why the bug will be marked '''Incomplete'''
* Set the status of the bug to '''Incomplete'''

If you are able to confirm this is still an issue with this most recent release please feel free to reopen this report.  To reopen the bug report you can click on the current status, under the Status column, and change the Status back to "New".  Thanks.
</pre>
